info.title: Helpmaton API
info.description: RESTful API for Helpmaton - AI agent workspace management and operations

tags.name: Spending Limits
tags.description: Spending limit management for workspaces and agents

bearerAuth.description: Bearer token authentication using JWT access tokens. Use the format: Authorization: Bearer <access-token>. Access tokens are obtained via /api/user/generate-tokens or /api/user/refresh-token.

permissionLevel.description: User's permission level in this workspace

delegatableAgentIds.description: IDs of agents that can be delegated to

enabledMcpServerToolNames.description: Per-server tool allowlist for MCP servers

enableMemorySearch.description: Enable the memory search tool for this agent

enableSearchDocuments.description: Enable the document search tool for this agent

enableKnowledgeInjection.description: Enable knowledge injection for this agent

knowledgeInjectionSnippetCount.description: Number of knowledge snippets to inject

knowledgeInjectionMinSimilarity.description: Minimum similarity score for injected snippets

knowledgeInjectionEntityExtractorModel.description: Model used to extract entities from prompts

enableSendEmail.description: Enable the email sending tool for this agent (requires workspace email connection)

enableImageGeneration.description: Enable the image generation tool for this agent

imageGenerationModel.description: Image generation model name from OpenRouter

memoryExtractionEnabled.description: Enable memory extraction for this agent

memoryExtractionModel.description: Model name to use for memory extraction

memoryExtractionPrompt.description: Prompt to use for memory extraction

name.description: Tool name (must be valid JavaScript identifier)

SummarizationPrompts.description: Optional summarization prompt overrides per temporal grain

delegatableAgentIds.description: IDs of agents that can be delegated to

enabledMcpServerToolNames.description: Per-server tool allowlist for MCP servers

enableMemorySearch.description: Enable the memory search tool for this agent

enableSearchDocuments.description: Enable the document search tool for this agent

enableKnowledgeInjection.description: Enable knowledge injection for this agent

knowledgeInjectionSnippetCount.description: Number of knowledge snippets to inject

knowledgeInjectionMinSimilarity.description: Minimum similarity score for injected snippets

knowledgeInjectionEntityExtractorModel.description: Model used to extract entities from prompts

enableSendEmail.description: Enable the email sending tool for this agent (requires workspace email connection)

enableImageGeneration.description: Enable the image generation tool for this agent

imageGenerationModel.description: Image generation model name from OpenRouter

memoryExtractionEnabled.description: Enable memory extraction for this agent

memoryExtractionModel.description: Model name to use for memory extraction

memoryExtractionPrompt.description: Prompt to use for memory extraction

delegatableAgentIds.description: IDs of agents that can be delegated to

enabledMcpServerToolNames.description: Per-server tool allowlist for MCP servers

enableMemorySearch.description: Enable the memory search tool for this agent

enableSearchDocuments.description: Enable the document search tool for this agent

enableSendEmail.description: Enable the email sending tool for this agent (requires workspace email connection)

enableImageGeneration.description: Enable the image generation tool for this agent

imageGenerationModel.description: Image generation model name from OpenRouter

memoryExtractionEnabled.description: Enable memory extraction for this agent

memoryExtractionModel.description: Model name to use for memory extraction

memoryExtractionPrompt.description: Prompt to use for memory extraction

agentId.description: Optional agent ID for editing existing agent

post.summary: Verify CAPTCHA and TOS acceptance for new users
post.description: Validates Cloudflare Turnstile and requires Terms acceptance before allowing new user sign-in.

callbackUrl.description: Auth callback URL from email link

post.description: Creates a new API key for the authenticated user. The key value is only returned once upon creation.

key.description: The API key value (only shown once - save this securely)

get.description: Returns all API keys for the authenticated user (masked)

lastUsedAt.description: When the key was last used

post.description: Validates a refresh token and returns new access and refresh tokens. The old refresh token is revoked. This endpoint does not require authentication as it uses the refresh token in the request body.

accessToken.description: New JWT access token (24 hours expiry)

refreshToken.description: New refresh token (30 days expiry, save securely)

post.description: Generates new access and refresh tokens for the authenticated user. Requires either a valid Bearer token or cookie-based session. This is typically called after initial login to get Bearer tokens.

refreshToken.description: Refresh token (30 days expiry, save securely)

delete.description: Deletes an API key for the authenticated user

put.description: Updates workspace name and description. Requires WRITE permission or higher. Trial-related fields cannot be modified through this endpoint.

get.description: Returns detailed information for a specific workspace including name, description, credit balance, currency, spending limits, permission level, and Google API key status. Requires READ permission or higher.

apiKeys.description: API key status for supported providers (only OpenRouter is supported for BYOK)

openrouter.description: Whether workspace has an OpenRouter API key configured

delete.description: Permanently deletes a workspace and all associated permissions, members, and resources. This action cannot be undone. Requires OWNER permission. All permission records for the workspace are also deleted.

put.description: Updates the amount for an existing spending limit for a specific time frame (daily, weekly, or monthly). The time frame must already exist. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: Time frame for the spending limit

delete.description: Removes a spending limit for a specific time frame (daily, weekly, or monthly). After deletion, there will be no limit for that time frame. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: Time frame for the spending limit

put.description: Updates a member's permission level (1=READ, 2=WRITE, 3=OWNER). You cannot grant a permission level higher than your own. For example, a WRITE user cannot grant OWNER permissions. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

delete.description: Removes a user from a workspace, revoking all their permissions. Cannot remove the last owner - a workspace must have at least one owner. This action cannot be undone. Requires OWNER permission.

put.description: Updates document content, name, or folder location. Supports both JSON content and file uploads.

get.description: Returns document content and metadata

delete.description: Deletes a document from the workspace and S3 storage

get.description: Returns details for a specific notification channel (without sensitive config)

delete.description: Deletes a notification channel. Cannot delete if any agents are using it.

put.description: Creates or updates an API key for a workspace for the specified provider. The API key is used for LLM provider integration. Pass an empty string to delete the key. The key value is stored securely and never returned in API responses. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

key.description: OpenRouter API key. Pass empty string to delete.

provider.description: LLM provider name (only openrouter is supported for BYOK)

204.description: API key deleted successfully (when key is empty string)

get.description: Returns whether the workspace has an API key configured for the specified provider. This is a boolean status check - the actual key value is never returned for security reasons. Requires READ permission or higher.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: LLM provider name (only openrouter is supported for BYOK)

hasKey.description: Whether workspace has an API key configured for the specified provider

delete.description: Permanently deletes the API key for a workspace for the specified provider. After deletion, the provider's services integration will no longer work until a new key is configured. This action cannot be undone. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: LLM provider name (only openrouter is supported for BYOK)

put.description: Updates agent configuration. Validates delegation chains to prevent circular references.

410.description: Agent or related resource not found

get.description: Returns details for a specific agent

delete.description: Deletes an agent from the workspace

put.description: Updates allowed CORS origins for an agent's stream server

allowedOrigins.description: Allowed CORS origins (use '*' for all or specific URLs)

post.description: Creates stream server configuration for an agent with allowed CORS origins

allowedOrigins.description: Allowed CORS origins (use '*' for all or specific URLs)

get.description: Returns stream server configuration for an agent including secret and allowed origins

delete.description: Deletes stream server configuration for an agent

get.description: Returns details for a specific MCP server (without sensitive config)

delete.description: Deletes an MCP server. Cannot delete if any agents are using it.

409.description: MCP server is in use by at least one agent

put.description: Updates email connection name or configuration

post.summary: Create or update workspace email connection
post.description: Creates a new email connection or updates existing one for a workspace

secure.description: Use secure connection (required for smtp type)

fromEmail.description: From email address (required for smtp type)

get.description: Returns email connection details for a workspace (without sensitive config)

delete.description: Deletes the email connection for a workspace

put.description: Updates the amount for an existing spending limit for a specific agent and time frame (daily, weekly, or monthly). The time frame must already exist. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: Time frame for the spending limit

delete.description: Removes a spending limit for a specific agent and time frame (daily, weekly, or monthly). After deletion, there will be no agent-level limit for that time frame, but workspace-level limits still apply. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: Time frame for the spending limit

get.description: Returns a single schedule configuration for an agent

put.description: Updates an existing eval judge configuration

get.description: Returns details for a specific eval judge

post.description: Creates a new workspace for the authenticated user

get.description: Returns all workspaces the authenticated user has access to

post.description:
Onboarding-agent flow. Accepts onboardingContext (step intent or refine with template + chatMessage),
runs the LLM with self-correction (up to 3 validation retries), and returns assistantText and
finalEvent (onboarding_agent_result or onboarding_agent_validation_failed). Subscription limits
are passed to the LLM so it respects plan limits.

onboardingContext.description: Discriminated by step; "intent" may include intent; "refine" requires template and chatMessage

intent.description: For step intent; goals, businessType, tasksOrRoles, freeText

template.description: For step refine; workspace export schema

200.description: Streamed or final result with assistantText and finalEvent

post.description: Dismisses a single suggestion for the workspace.

Creates a spending limit for a workspace to control costs over a specific time period (daily, weekly, or monthly). When the limit is reached, operations that would exceed it will be blocked. Multiple limits can be set for different time frames. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

timeFrame.description: Time period for the spending limit

post.description: Adds an existing user to a workspace with the specified permission level (1=READ, 2=WRITE, 3=OWNER). Defaults to READ if not specified. Requires WRITE permission or higher. The user must already have an account in the system.

userId.description: User ID to add to workspace

get.description: Returns all members of a workspace with their permission levels (READ, WRITE, or OWNER), user IDs, email addresses, and join dates. Requires READ permission or higher.

post.description: Creates and sends an email invite to join a workspace. The invite includes a permission level (1=READ, 2=WRITE, 3=OWNER) and expires after a set period. The invite email is sent automatically. Requires OWNER permission. The invited user must be within the subscription's user limit.
Creates a new Slack or Discord bot integration for an agent

get.description: Lists all bot integrations for a workspace

post.description: Generates a Slack app manifest JSON with pre-filled webhook URL
Creates or updates a Discord slash command for a bot integration

Creates a new workspace from an exported workspace configuration JSON. Includes all agents, output channels, email connections, MCP servers, and bot integrations. All IDs will be regenerated as new UUIDs.
Uploads one or more documents (files or text) to a workspace. Supports up to 50 files. Allowed types are md, txt, and markdown.

files.description: Files to upload (max 10MB each, up to 50 files)

textDocuments.description: JSON array of text documents with name and content

get.description: Returns all documents in a workspace, optionally filtered by folder

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Optional folder path to filter documents

post.description: Creates a new notification channel for a workspace

botToken.description: Discord bot token (required for discord type)

discordChannelId.description: Discord channel ID (required for discord type)

webhookUrl.description: Slack webhook URL (required for slack type)

get.description: Returns all notification channels in a workspace

post.description: Creates a new AI agent in the workspace

modelName.description: Model name (must be available in pricing config)

avatar.description: Avatar image path (e.g., "/images/helpmaton_logo_10.svg"). If not provided, a random avatar will be assigned.

get.description: Returns paginated list of agents in a workspace

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of agents to return (1-100, default 50)

post.description: Submits a request for trial credits for a workspace. Requires CAPTCHA validation (Cloudflare Turnstile token) and the user must be within the 7-day trial period from account creation. Only one request can be made per workspace. The request is sent to administrators for approval. Requires WRITE permission or higher.
Sends a test email through the connection to verify configuration
Sends a test notification through the channel to verify configuration
Creates a new MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for a workspace

get.description: Returns all MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers in a workspace

post.description: Disconnects the OAuth connection for an OAuth-based MCP server by clearing OAuth tokens

post.summary: Improve an agent system prompt using evaluation results
post.description: Generates a revised system prompt based on selected evaluation results and user instructions

post.summary: Generate system prompt for an agent
post.description: Generates a system prompt for an AI agent based on a user-provided goal and available tools

410.description: Agent not found (when agentId is provided)

post.summary: Generate presigned S3 POST URL for file upload
post.description: Generates a presigned POST URL that allows direct upload of files to S3. The URL expires after 5 minutes. Supports all file types.

contentType.description: File content type (e.g., image/jpeg, application/pdf, text/plain)

uploadUrl.description: S3 endpoint URL for POST request

fields.description: Form fields to include in multipart/form-data POST

finalUrl.description: Final S3 URL after upload (use this in messages)

options.summary: CORS preflight for file upload URL endpoint

post.description: Dismisses a single suggestion for the agent.

Creates a spending limit for a specific agent to control costs over a specific time period (daily, weekly, or monthly). Agent-level limits work in addition to workspace-level limits. When either limit is reached, operations will be blocked. Requires WRITE permission or higher.

timeFrame.description: Time period for the spending limit

post.summary: Create a schedule for an agent
post.description: Creates a new schedule configuration for an agent (UTC cron)

prompt.description: First user message for scheduled run

get.description: Returns all schedules configured for an agent

post.description: Creates a new API key for an agent. The key value is only returned once upon creation.

type.description: Key type - 'webhook' for webhook authentication, 'widget' for widget authentication

key.description: The API key value (only shown once)

get.description: Returns all API keys for an agent

key.description: The API key value (only shown when created)

post.summary: Create an eval judge for an agent
post.description: Creates a new evaluation judge configuration for an agent

get.summary: List eval judges for an agent
get.description: Returns all evaluation judges configured for an agent

post.description: Accepts a workspace invite using the invite token. Works for both authenticated and unauthenticated users. For authenticated users, immediately grants access to the workspace. For unauthenticated users, creates a new account and returns a callback URL for email verification. The invite must be valid and not expired. After acceptance, the user gains the permission level specified in the invite.

callbackUrl.description: Email verification callback URL (only for unauthenticated users)

patch.description: Updates a bot integration (status, name, config)

get.description: Gets a single bot integration

patch.description: Renames a document (updates filename in S3)

get.description: Returns the current user count, maximum users allowed based on the workspace's subscription plan, plan name, and whether more users can be invited. Useful for checking if the workspace has reached its user limit before inviting new members. Requires READ permission or higher.

currentUserCount.description: Current number of users in workspace

maxUsers.description: Maximum users allowed by subscription plan

canInvite.description: Whether more users can be invited

get.description: Returns usage statistics for a workspace

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns daily breakdown of usage statistics for a workspace

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns paginated list of credit transactions for a workspace, sorted by most recent first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions to return (1-100, default 50)

nextCursor.description: Cursor for next page of results

get.description: Returns LLM-generated suggestions for the workspace. May take a few seconds on first load. Does not block the main workspace response.

Returns all pending (non-expired, non-accepted) invites for a workspace. Only shows invites that have not been accepted and have not expired. Includes invite ID, email, permission level, expiration date, and creation date. Requires OWNER permission.

Returns invite details for a given token, including workspace name, email, permission level, inviter email, and expiration date. This endpoint does not require authentication and is typically used when a user clicks an invite link. Returns 404 if the invite is not found, expired, or already accepted.
Exports a complete workspace configuration as a downloadable JSON file. Includes all agents, output channels, email connections, MCP servers, and bot integrations. Requires READ permission or higher.
Search documents in a workspace using semantic vector search. Returns the most relevant document snippets based on the query.
Returns all unique folder paths in a workspace

folders.description: Sorted list of unique folder paths

get.summary: Get all workspace API key statuses
get.description: Returns the API key status for all supported providers for a workspace. This is a boolean status check - the actual key values are never returned for security reasons. Requires READ permission or higher.

200.description: API key statuses for all providers

provider.description: LLM provider name (only openrouter is supported for BYOK)

hasKey.description: Whether workspace has an API key configured for this provider

get.description: Returns comprehensive trial period status and credit usage information for a workspace, including whether the user is still in the trial period, days remaining, whether credits have been requested, approval status, initial credit amount, and current usage percentage. Useful for displaying trial information in the UI. Requires READ permission or higher.
Returns the tools provided by a single MCP server, including parameters and descriptions

200.description: List of tools grouped by category

get.summary: Get MCP server OAuth connection status
get.description: Returns the OAuth connection status for an OAuth-based MCP server

email.description: User email from OAuth provider (if available)

get.summary: Get MCP server OAuth authorization URL
get.description: Returns the OAuth authorization URL for connecting an OAuth-based MCP server

authUrl.description: OAuth authorization URL to redirect user to

get.description: Handles OAuth callback from email provider. Extracts workspaceId from state token and creates/updates email connection. Redirects to frontend on success or error. Works for both authenticated and unauthenticated users (redirects to login if needed).

302.description: Redirects to frontend success/error page or login page

get.description: Returns the OAuth authorization URL for Gmail or Outlook email connection setup

authUrl.description: OAuth authorization URL to redirect user to

get.description: Returns usage statistics for a specific agent

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns daily breakdown of usage statistics for an agent

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns paginated list of credit transactions for an agent, sorted by most recent first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions to return (1-100, default 50)

nextCursor.description: Cursor for next page of results

get.description: Returns a list of all tools available to the agent, grouped by category

200.description: List of tools grouped by category

get.description: Returns LLM-generated suggestions for the agent. May take a few seconds on first load. Does not block the main agent response.
Returns memory records for a specific agent, with optional semantic search and temporal filtering

parameters.name: grain
parameters.description: Temporal grain to search (working, daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly)

parameters.name: queryText
parameters.description: Optional semantic search query. If empty, only temporal filtering is applied.

parameters.name: minimumDaysAgo
parameters.description: Minimum age of results in days (default: 0)

parameters.name: maximumDaysAgo
parameters.description: Maximum age of results in days (default: 365)

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 50)

parameters.name: previewLength
parameters.description: If set, truncates content to the first N characters

get.summary: Get an agent memory record by ID
get.description: Returns a full memory record for a specific agent by record ID.

parameters.name: grain
parameters.description: Temporal grain to search (working, daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly)

get.description: Returns knowledge graph facts for an agent with optional text filtering

parameters.name: queryText
parameters.description: Optional text filter for graph facts

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of facts to return (default: 200, max: 500)

get.summary: Get aggregated evaluation results for an agent
get.description: Returns aggregated evaluation results for an agent, optionally filtered by time span. Results are paginated.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default 50, max 100)

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching next page

totalEvaluations.description: Total number of evaluations matching filters (across all pages)

criticalFailures.description: Total number of critical failures (across all pages)

nextCursor.description: Cursor for fetching next page, null if no more pages

get.description: Returns paginated list of conversations for an agent, sorted by most recent first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of conversations to return (1-100, default 50)

nextCursor.description: Cursor for next page of results

get.description: Returns full details of a specific conversation including messages, tool calls, and results

targetConversationId.description: Conversation ID of the target agent's conversation

get.summary: Get evaluation results for a conversation
get.description: Returns all evaluation results for a specific conversation

delete.description: Permanently deletes a workspace invite, preventing it from being accepted. This is useful for revoking invites that are no longer needed. The invite cannot be recovered after deletion. Requires OWNER permission.
Deletes an API key for an agent

get.description: Returns the current product version of the frontend bundle
Returns daily breakdown of usage statistics across all workspaces the authenticated user has access to

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns aggregated usage statistics across all workspaces the authenticated user has access to

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for usage statistics (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

get.description: Returns the Lambda Function URL for streaming agent interactions

url.description: The Lambda Function URL for streaming

get.description: Returns pricing information for all available OpenRouter AI models

cachedInput.description: Price per 1M cached input tokens (USD, optional)

get.description: Returns a list of available OpenRouter AI models and their default model, including re-ranking models from pricing.json
Verifies API and database connectivity
